title: Money expansion and new loans in Sande Bank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Sande Bank holds reserves of <math alttext="$5,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$5,000</mtext></mstyle></math> and demand deposits of <math alttext="$15,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$15,000</mtext></mstyle></math>. The banking system has limited reserves, and the required reserve ratio is <math alttext="20%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) What is the amount of Sande Bank’s liabilities? Explain

(b) Calculate Sande Bank’s required reserves. Show your work.

(c) Given the amount of reserves and demand deposits, what is the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans Sande Bank can make? Explain.

(d) Based on your answer to part (c), calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can change throughout the banking system. Show your work.

(e) If the central bank would like to reverse the effect on the nominal interest rate caused by the change in the money supply in part (d), what open market operation should the central bank take? Explain.
